top_categories.workout_context: Seven’s parallel singletrack, pine plantation roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Seven isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Seven rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Seven when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Seven’s narrow parallel singletrack through pine plantations and state forests and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Seven’s 10,500ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Seven. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Seven — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Seven’s narrow parallel singletrack through pine plantations and state forests drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Seven — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on narrow parallel singletrack through pine plantations and state forests.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Seven’s 10,500ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Seven’s narrow parallel singletrack through pine plantations and state forests delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Seven’s 78 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Seven. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Seven demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride narrow parallel singletrack through pine plantations and state forests at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: parallel singletrack, pine plantation roads, quartz gravel. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 78 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 78 miles of narrow parallel singletrack through pine plantations and state forests in Nannup, Western Australia.
